title: Quasiperiodic attractors, Borel summability and the Bryuno condition for strongly dissipative systems
abstract:
We consider a class of ordinary differential equations describing one-dimensional\ud
analytic systems with a quasiperiodic forcing term and in the presence of damping.\ud
In the limit of large damping, under some generic nondegeneracy condition on the\ud
force, there are quasiperiodic solutions which have the same frequency vector as\ud
the forcing term. We prove that such solutions are Borel summable at the origin\ud
when the frequency vector is either any one-dimensional number or a twodimensional\ud
vector such that the ratio of its components is an irrational number of\ud
constant type. In the first case the proof given simplifies that provided in a previous\ud
work of ours. We also show that in any dimension d, for the existence of a quasiperiodic\ud
solution with the same frequency vector as the forcing term, the standard\ud
Diophantine condition can be weakened into the Bryuno condition. In all cases,\ud
under a suitable positivity condition, the quasiperiodic solution is proved to describe\ud
a local attractor

We consider a class of ordinary differential equations describing one-dimensional
analytic systems with a quasiperiodic forcing term and in the presence of damping.
In the limit of large damping, under some generic nondegeneracy condition on the
force, there are quasiperiodic solutions which have the same frequency vector as
the forcing term. We prove that such solutions are Borel summable at the origin
when the frequency vector is either any one-dimensional number or a two-
dimensional vector such that the ratio of its components is an irrational number of
constant type. In the first case the proof given simplifies that provided in a previous
work of ours. We also show that in any dimension d, for the existence of a quasi-
periodic solution with the same frequency vector as the forcing term, the standard
Diophantine condition can be weakened into the Bryuno condition. In all cases,
under a suitable positivity condition, the quasiperiodic solution is proved to de-
scribe a local attractor. © 2006 American Institute of Physics.
